newsitem.title: USA: Elizabeth Taylor leaves hospital after surgery.
newsitem.headline: Elizabeth Taylor leaves hospital after surgery.

text.p: Oscar-winning actress Elizabeth Taylor, who underwent brain surgery six days ago, was discharged on Wednesday from the hospital in time for her 65th birthday on Thursday, a spokesman said.
"She has made an excellent recovery and was sent home at 1 p.m. (PST)," Ron Wise, spokesman for Cedars-Sinai Medical Centre, said.
Taylor's publicist Shirene Coburn said on Tuesday: "Doctors are extremely pleased with her progress. She (Taylor) is in great spirits."
Taylor underwent delicate surgery for nearly four hours last Thursday to remove an apparently benign tumour the size of a golf ball from her brain.
The tumour, in the lining of her parietal lobe just behind the left ear, was detected this month during a brain scan as part of a routine physical examination.
The operation, originally scheduled for Feb. 17, was postponed partly because Taylor had been suffering from the flu and also because of a scheduling conflict with her surgeons.
Taylor also put off the surgery to attend a star-studded gala birthday party in Hollywood on Feb. 16 to benefit AIDS research, her favourite charity.
